Reason: The configuration option 'tracetype_repair_ttl' is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'tracetype_repair_ttl' configuration directly affects the TTL (Time to Live) for repair sessions in the system. The TTL value determines how long repair sessions are kept active, impacting memory consumption and resource utilization. Additionally, the code related to the 'tracetype_repair_ttl' configuration involves operations that contribute to the execution time and memory usage, such as setting and retrieving TTL values for repair sessions. These time-expensive and memory-expensive operations can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making the configuration performance-sensitive.
